Key Findings

  • The Capital department has received the largest allocation of funds, with a total of £46.0M, accounting for 31.4% of the total spend.
  • Planning Policy is the second-highest funded department, with £16.0M allocated, representing 11.0% of the total spend.
  • The top three departments, including General Government Grants with £15.1M, collectively account for 52.7% of the total spend, with £77.1M allocated to them.

Departmental Spending Overview

The spending data for South Ribble Borough Council reveals a clear hierarchy in terms of departmental allocations. The Capital department stands out as the largest recipient of funds, with a total of £46.0M allocated to it. This significant investment suggests that the council is prioritising capital projects and initiatives.

In addition to the Capital department, Planning Policy and General Government Grants are also notable recipients of funding, with £16.0M and £15.1M allocated to them, respectively. These figures indicate that the council is committed to planning and development, as well as providing grants to support various initiatives.

Breakdown of Departmental Spend

A closer examination of the spending data reveals a diverse range of departments and services, each with its own unique allocation of funds. The following table provides a breakdown of the top departments:

Department Amount % of Total
Capital £46.0M 31.4%
Planning Policy £16.0M 11.0%
General Government Grants £15.1M 10.3%
Corporate Management £14.4M 9.8%
Central Support Services £14.0M 9.6%

This table highlights the significant investments made in various departments, with Capital and Planning Policy receiving the largest allocations. The General Government Grants department also receives a substantial amount, indicating the council's commitment to supporting local initiatives.

Implications and Context

The spending data provides valuable insights into the council's priorities and allocation of resources. The significant investment in Capital projects suggests that the council is focused on long-term development and growth. Additionally, the allocation of funds to Planning Policy and General Government Grants indicates a commitment to supporting local communities and initiatives.

The data also highlights the importance of Corporate Management and Central Support Services, which receive substantial allocations of £14.4M and £14.0M, respectively. These departments play a crucial role in supporting the council's overall operations and ensuring the effective delivery of services.

What You Can Do

  • Submit a Freedom of Information request to South Ribble Borough Council about the specific projects and initiatives funded by the Capital department.
  • Attend council committee meetings, which are open to the public, to gain a deeper understanding of the council's decision-making processes and priorities.
  • Check the council's published contracts register to learn more about the suppliers and contractors working with the council.
  • Write to your local councillor about your concerns or suggestions regarding the allocation of funds to various departments and services.
  • Visit aidoge.co.uk to explore the full spending data and gain a more comprehensive understanding of the council's financial activities.
This article is based on South Ribble Borough Council's published spending data covering 2021/22 to 2024/25. All figures are drawn directly from transactions published under the Local Government Transparency Code. Analysis by AI DOGE.
